quizzes.title: Entertainment Quiz: Song and Happy Birthday
quizzes.description: Test your entertainment knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Entertainment, rhode, tv. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: With which TV programme was Cathy McGowan associated?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Ready Steady Go

questions.question: How many commas are there in the written version of the song, Good Morning to All?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: 4

questions.question: The lead singer of which of the following bands did not have a solo UK chart single in the 1960s?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Hermans Hermits

questions.question: Happy Birthday to You was written by two teachers from this city.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Louisville

questions.question: What was the Happy Birthday song originally written as?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: A classroom greeting

questions.question: Happy Birthday to You was reported in Time, January 2, 1989, to be the most popular song in the English Language.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: True

questions.question: Cyndi Lauper was inducted into the Rhode Island Music Hall of Fame in January of 2007.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: False

questions.question: In what year was the Happy Birthday song written?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: 1893

questions.question: In 1988, Birch Tree Group, Ltd. sold the rights of the song Happy Birthday to You along with all other assets to Warner Communications for this amount of money.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: $25 million

questions.question: Which bands lead singer was Paul Jones?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Manfred Mann

questions.question: Which one of these was not one of Cyndi Laupers record labels?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Blue Angel Records

questions.question: If you were to compare Good Morning to All and Happy Birthday to You word by word, how many words would match up (same words in the same place)?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: 6 possibly 7

questions.question: In what year was the song Happy Birthday to You first copyrighted?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: 1935

questions.question: Are these the lyrics to the song Happy Birthday to You:
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: No

questions.question: These are the lyrics to the song Good Morning to All:
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: False

quizzes.title: Entertainment Quiz: Album and Bands
quizzes.description: Test your entertainment knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Entertainment, vocalist, cilla. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: Which of the following female singers has a link to Sidney Poitier?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Lulu

questions.question: What was Cilla Blacks real first name?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Priscilla

questions.question: Which Beatle/s actually wrote the song Yesterday?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Paul

questions.question: What did the original cover of the album Appetite for Destruction depict?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: 27 million

questions.question: Who was the last Beatle to join the Fab Four?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Ringo

questions.question: Guns N Roses was formed by members of two bands merging together. What were these bands?

options.text: California Guns and The Sweet Roses

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: L.A. Guns and Hollywood Roses

questions.question: Which of the following bands was Australian?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The Easybeats

questions.question: Who was the lead vocalist and keyboard player for The Dave Clark Five?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Mike Smith

questions.question: Is it true that one of the original 5 members of Guns n Roses died in 1991 under uncertain circumstances?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Yes

questions.question: Who did Axl Rose co-write Sweet Child o Mine for?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: His future wife

questions.question: When was Guns N Roses first performance?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: March 26, 1985

questions.question: Name the 80s R-n-B song that was performed by the group named Tease.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Firestarter

questions.question: The hits of which of these female singers were written mainly by Chris Andrews?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Sandie Shaw

questions.question: In the middle of a performance of Rocket Queen in St. Louis Axl Rose tackled a spectator and declared, Thanks to this lame a** security, Im going home. He slammed down his mike and a riot started. What was the fan that Rose tackled doing?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Videotaping the performance

questions.question: Before the first full album was ready, Guns N Roses wanted to keep interest in themselves, but had to stop performing to work on the album. So, they released this four song mini-album.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Live ?!*@ Like a Suicide

quizzes.title: Entertainment Quiz: Song and Hit
quizzes.description: Test your entertainment knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Entertainment, producer/singer, junior. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: How Do I Live was a big hit song for this country superstar in 1997.

questions.question: Who recorded Quit Playin Games (With My Heart), one of the biggest songs of 1997?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Backstreet Boys

questions.question: How Bizarre was a huge song for this group in 1997.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: OMC

questions.question: The group Hanson had a big hit in 1997 with this song.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: MMM Bop

questions.question: Who sang the 1997 hit song Barbie Girl?

questions.question: This duo had a hit called Dont Disturb This Groove.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The System

questions.question: Finish the lyrics from this 1982 song by Junior:  Mama used to say, . . .
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: . . . take your time young man

questions.question: The song Ill Be Missing You was a big hit song for Puff Daddy, the group 112 and this female singer in 1997.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Faith Evans

questions.question: The 1997 song Where Have All the Cowboys Gone was a top ten U.S. hit for this singer.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Paula Cole

questions.question: You Make Me Wanna was a huge hit for this RB singer in 1997.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Usher

questions.question: Juicy, a brother and sister act, hailing from North Carolina, had a 1985 R-n-B hit with this song that has been sampled by many of todays rappers.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Sugar Free

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Imagination

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Mine All Mine

quizzes.title: Entertainment Quiz: Song and Member
quizzes.description: Test your entertainment knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Entertainment, randy, country. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: Which essential Beat figure was a mainstay of The Grateful Dead scene until his death in 1968?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Neal Cassady

questions.question: Where was The Grateful Deads management office and, for a time, communal residence located?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: 710 Ashbury St., San Francisco

questions.question: Which was the first album released by country super star Clint Black?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Killin Time

questions.question: Singer Seal had a hit song in 1997 with a re-make of a popular 70s Steve Miller Band song. What was the name of this song?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Fly Like an Eagle

questions.question: Which of the following was not a member of a pre-Grateful Dead band that also had a member of The Grateful Dead in it?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Jorma Koukonen

questions.question: Before becoming The Grateful Dead, the band booked gigs under what name?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The Warlocks

questions.question: The band that became known as The Grateful Dead had a six-week long, six nights per week standing gig at what venue?

options.text: St. Michaels Alley in Palo Alto, CA
The In Room in Belmont, CA

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The In Room in Belmont, CA

questions.question: Randy Travis released the album Always  Forever in 1987.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: True

questions.question: Name the first-born child of The Grateful Dead member Jerry Garcia.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Heather Garcia

questions.question: Which member of the psychedelic music pioneers The Grateful Dead eschewed the ingestion of LSD?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Ron Pigpen McKernan

questions.question: What artist is famous for the 1979 song The Devil Went Down To Georgia?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Charlie Daniels

questions.question: Hello, I Love You was a huge song in 1968 for this band out of the California area.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The Doors

questions.question: Hey Paula was a HUGE #1 U.S. hit song for this group in the year 1963.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Paul  Paula

questions.question: Phil Lesh, a member of The Grateful Dead, was a graduate of what high school?

options.text: Mt. Tamalpais High School (Marin County, CA)

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Berkeley High School

questions.question: Which of these artists is known for the song This Cowboys Hat?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Chris LeDoux

quizzes.title: Entertainment Quiz: David Bowie and Song
quizzes.description: Test your entertainment knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Entertainment, toe, bowies. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: Head to Toe was a #1 U.S. for this group in 1987.

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Fleetwood Mac

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Steve Winwood

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: False

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: False

quizzes.title: Entertainment Quiz: Album and Time
quizzes.description: Test your entertainment knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Entertainment, nat, magazine. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: Who recorded Let It Bleed, the #32 album on Rolling Stone magazines list of greatest albums of all time?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The Rolling Stones

questions.question: Nat King Cole lived his early life in what section of Chicago, famous for its jazz clubs?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Bronzeville

questions.question: Never Mind the Bollocks is ranked #41 on Rolling Stones list of greatest albums of all time. Who recorded this album?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Sex Pistols

questions.question: This song, written by Mel Torme, was recorded by Nat King Cole in 1946.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The Christmas Song

questions.question: In Los Angeles, Nat King Cole, along with guitarist Oscar Moore and bassist Wesley Prince, formed which group?

options.text: Nat King Cole and His Court

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The Nat King Cole Trio

questions.question: Who recorded the album Legend, ranked #46 on Rolling Stone magazines list of greatest albums of all time?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Bob Marley and the Wailers

questions.question: In the mid 1930s, while still a teenager, Nat King Cole began his performing career, inspired and influenced by which prominent jazz pianist?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Earl Fatha Hines

questions.question: Who recorded the album Please Please Me, ranked #39 by Rolling Stone magazine?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The Beatles

questions.question: This song, based on folk material, was Nat King Coles first mainstream vocal hit.

options.text: Lazy, Hazy, Crazy Days of Summer

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Straighten Up and Fly Right

questions.question: Rolling Stone magazine has Electric Ladyland ranked #55 on their top 500 greatest album of all time list. Who was the artist who released this album?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Jimi Hendrix

questions.question: Who was the artists that recorded The Rise and Fall of Ziggy Stardust and the Spiders from Mars, ranked #35 by Rolling Stone magazine?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: David Bowie

questions.question: This music company, founded in 1942, was sometimes referred to as The House that Nat Built.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Capitol Records

questions.question: American singer and jazz musician Nat King Cole was born Nathaniel Adams Coles, in which city?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Montgomery, Alabama

questions.question: The #51 album on Rolling Stones list of greatest albums of all time, entitled Bridge Over Troubled Water, was released by this group/artist.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Simon  Garfunkel

questions.question: Who released Live at Filmore East, the album ranked #49 on Rolling Stone magazines list of greatest albums of all time?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The Allman Brothers Band
